text: I have a blog post that is no longer on the site (unpublished but not archived) but the post is still showing in my site results. When you click on a link you get a 404 error. Any way to force this post to be removed? <https://www.tmhnc.com/used-equipement/search/used-ic-pneumatic?term=U19257&portalId=490683&tag=Used+IC+Pneumatic&limit=100&groupId=3933452779&type=BLOG_POST&hsCacheBuster=9198> 2nd item.
is there a variable for is_published?

I added a is_published=true parameter to the search input and it does not appear to make a difference. <https://www.tmhnc.com/used-equipement/search/used-ic-pneumatic?term=U19257&portalId=490683&tag=Used+IC+Pneumatic&limit=100&groupId=3933452779&type=BLOG_POST&is_published=true>
Okay, so <@UDPA7JFHA> I did an api call and got the following results: <https://gist.github.com/NickDeckerDevs/b283cb2b937b51843c9baaea6565df0b>

What I see here is that both have a publish date. meaning the api isn't seeing that something isn't published, it just sees that it has a publish date and is accepting this as a live page. This is likely a bug in HS search and you probably can't work around it. They will either have to fix this or you would need to archive the page.  You can test that out by cloning these pages and then modifying your search
Thanks. I will see if that is an option.
Is there a reason why the page is not published but still there?

I was thinking you could do a js loop through the items, parse the link, and determine if they are the same then you could eliminate that -- however that won't work because of the way they dynamically create the links for each search item.

<@U22PJPGK0> this maybe a bug in the site search. not sure if you are the right person to mention this, but it appears that a page that has been published, then unpublished is showing up in the results for site search, possibly because it is based on a publish date
